text: Meet the Team Michael LÃ³pez-AlegrÃ­a Michael LÃ³pez-AlegrÃ­a is a decorated astronaut who returned to low-Earth orbit for the sixth time in 2024 as commander of Axiom Mission 3. He also commanded Axiom Spaceâs first private astronaut mission to the International Space Station (ISS) in 2022, known as Axiom Mission 1. âMike L-Aâ (as heâs known to the space community) is involved in both operational and business development efforts within Axiom Space. He has more than 40 years of aviation and space experience with the U.S. Navy and NASA in a variety of roles including Naval Aviator, engineering test pilot and program manager, NASA astronaut, and International Space Station commander. He also holds NASA records for most extravehicular activities (EVAs) or âspacewalksâ (10) and cumulative EVA time (67 hours, 40 minutes). He was inducted into the U.S. Astronaut Hall of Fame in 2021. Mike L-A is the former president of the Commercial Spaceflight Federation, where he was a spokesman, thought leader, and advocate with the U.S. Congress and pertinent Executive Agencies for favorable public policy on behalf of the commercial spaceflight industry. He has served on several advisory boards and committees of public and private organizations, including the Human Exploration and Operations Committee of the NASA Advisory Council and the Commercial Space Transportation Advisory Committee (COMSTAC) to the FAA, and is the former chairman of ASTM Internationalâs Committee on Commercial Spaceflight as well as past President of the Association of Space Explorers. He earned a B.S. in systems engineering at the United States Naval Academy and an M.S. in aeronautical engineering from the Naval Postgraduate School. Close Close Michael Lopez-Alegria Michael López-Alegría has over 40 years of aviation and space experience with the U.S. Navy and NASA in a variety of roles including Naval Aviator, engineering test pilot and program manager, NASA astronaut, and International Space Station commander. He is a four-time astronaut, having flown on Space Shuttle missions STS-73, STS-92, and STS- 113, and serving as Commander of ISS Expedition 14 (flying to and from the ISS aboard Soyuz TMA-9). He holds NASA records for most Extravehicular Activities (EVA) or “space walks” (10) and cumulative EVA time (67 hours 40 minutes). López-Alegría is the former President of the Commercial Space Federation, where he was a spokesman, thought leader and advocate with the U.S. Congress and pertinent Executive Agencies for favorable public policy on behalf of the commercial spaceflight industry. He serves on several advisory boards and committees of public and private organizations, including the Human Exploration and Operations Committee of the NASA Advisory Council and the Commercial Space Transportation Advisory Committee to the FAA. López-Alegría is the Chairman of ASTM International’s Committee on Commercial Spaceflight as well as the President of the Association of Space Explorers USA, a professional and educational organization of current and former astronauts. He is based in Washington, DC. SURESH Trent MARTIN Saroj Kumar Jitendra SINGH Vimmi CHOUDHARY Radhakrishnan Durairaj Narendra MODI Michael López-Alegría is Chief Astronaut at Axiom Space. He is a decorated astronaut who returned to low-Earth orbit for the sixth time in 2024 as Commander of Axiom Mission 3, leading history’s first private mission made up of all government-sponsored crew to the International Space Station. “Mike L-A” (as he’s known to the space community) is involved in both operational and business development efforts within Axiom Space. He has more than 40 years of aviation and space experience with the U.S. Navy and NASA in a variety of roles including Naval Aviator, engineering test pilot and program manager, NASA astronaut, and International Space Station commander. He also holds NASA records for most extravehicular activities (EVAs) or ”spacewalks” (10) and cumulative EVA time (67 hours, 40 minutes). He was inducted into the U.S. Astronaut Hall of Fame in 2021. Mike L-A is the former president of the Commercial Spaceflight Federation, where he was a spokesman, thought leader, and advocate with the U.S. Congress and pertinent Executive Agencies for favorable public policy on behalf of the commercial spaceflight industry. He has served on several advisory boards and committees of public and private organizations, including the Human Exploration and Operations Committee of the NASA Advisory Council and the Commercial Space Transportation Advisory Committee (COMSTAC) to the FAA, and is past chairman of ASTM International’s Committee on Commercial Spaceflight as well as past president of the Association of Space Explorers. He earned a B.S. in systems engineering at the United States Naval Academy and an M.S. in aeronautical engineering from the Naval Postgraduate School. Lopez, MD, PhD 205-638-2551 Locations Medical Office 1600 7th Ave. South CHB 314 , AL 35233 Medical Office 1600 7th Avenue South McWane Building Birmingham, AL 35233 About Me Assistant Professor, Other UAB Titles: Associate Scientist, UAB Center for Exercise Medicine, Pediatric Neuromuscular Medicine Clinic, Muscular Dystrophy Association Clinic, and Nerve Conduction / Electromyography Clinic Basic science research in childhood-onset muscle disorders like Duchenne muscular dystrophy. Education Residency: Baylor College of Medicine , Child Neurology Residency: Texas Children's Hospital Medical School: University of Michigan Medical School Fellowship: Stanford University , Neuromuscular Medicine Internship: Texas Children's Hospital - Baylor College of Medicine UnderGraduate: Drexel University , Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering Graduate: Baylor College of Medicine , PhD in Structural and Computational Biology Board Certifications Neurology, American Board of Psychiatry & Neurology Languages English Special Interests Clinical interests include muscular dystrophies, congenital myopathies, neuromuscular junction disorders, spinal muscular atrophy, and acquired/inherited polyneuropathies. About About Video Video Press Press Gallery Gallery Inquiries Inquiries About Video Press Gallery Inquiries Commander of Ax-1 & Ax-3 Record Holder for EVAs (Spacewalks) Inductee of Astronaut Hall of Fame Welcome to MLASpace Michael López-Alegría is Chief Astronaut at Axiom Space. He is a decorated astronaut who returned to low-Earth orbit for the sixth time in 2024 as Commander of Axiom Mission 3, leading history’s first private mission made up of all government-sponsored crew to the International Space Station. “Mike L-A” (as he’s known to the space community) is involved in both operational and business development efforts within Axiom Space. He has more than 40 years of aviation and space experience with the U.S. Navy and NASA in a variety of roles including Naval Aviator, engineering test pilot and program manager, NASA astronaut, and International Space Station commander. He also holds NASA records for most extravehicular activities (EVAs) or ”spacewalks” (10) and cumulative EVA time (67 hours, 40 minutes). He was inducted into the U.S. Astronaut Hall of Fame in 2021. Mike L-A is the former president of the Commercial Spaceflight Federation, where he was a spokesman, thought leader, and advocate with the U.S. Congress and pertinent Executive Agencies for favorable public policy on behalf of the commercial spaceflight industry. He has served on several advisory boards and committees of public and private organizations, including the Human Exploration and Operations Committee of the NASA Advisory Council and the Commercial Space Transportation Advisory Committee (COMSTAC) to the FAA, and is past chairman of ASTM International’s Committee on Commercial Spaceflight as well as past president of the Association of Space Explorers. He earned a B.S. in systems engineering at the United States Naval Academy and an M.S. in aeronautical engineering from the Naval Postgraduate School.
